result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Floyd A Worth

records.addlTxt: Amended Restitution Order in the total amount of $2,060.30
# 1 - DVD of audio clip filed by ADA Ross

2:21 PM Cases called: 21CF435 and 22CF133. Defendant Floyd A Worth in court.  Attorney Jonas Bednarek in court for Floyd A Worth. Attorney Jonathan Ross in court for State of Wisconsin. Agreement recited by State. Attorney Bednark requested 10 days time to review the restitution. Court reviewed the rights & elements. Defendant pled no contest to count 1 of 21cf435. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment. Counts 2 - 4 dismissed and read in. 22CF133 dismissed and read in. Victim statement, including an audio clip from cell phone. State is to submit audio as an exhibit at courts request. Sentencing statements. Court withheld sentence, placed the defendant on probation for 10 years. Conditions of probation include: 1 year jail, with Huber, no good time. May transfer to Dane County jail. $518.00 costs. Apology letter to victim given to agent. No contact w/A.J.V. her residence, her work or vehicle, only contact is through the app and for child exchange purposes. Complete an AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations. Not possess or consume controlled substances without a valid Rx. Not possess drug paraphernalia. Complete domestic violence counseling. Submit DNA sample. Restitution will be held open at this time. 2 days credit. Jail start 10-10-22 at 7:00 PM.   3:47 PM
